lead_paragraph: As the creative director of Chez Panisse, the Kyoto, Japan-born chef Sylvan Mishima Brackett learned a thing or two about catering intimate events with élan. Add to this his mother's down-to-earth cooking and the artful presentation at the restaurants where he apprenticed in Japan, and you've got the influences behind Peko-Peko, the catering business Brackett opened in 2008. "I wanted to cook food that was relaxed and delicious and easy to appreciate," he says. Brackett has gained a following with his seasonal bento - dishes include pickled plum, Dungeness crab rice and miso-cured black cod - delivered in bamboo husk boxes. Go to interactive feature >>
